intro: Venidium intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate venidium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Venidium intermedium is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects.
